tree.name: rye
tree.description: An Experimental Package Management Solution for Python

add.name: add
add.description: Adds a Python package to this project

arguments.name: ...requirements
arguments.description: The package to add as PEP 508 requirement string. e.g. 'flask==2.2.3'

options.name: --git
options.description: Install the given package from this git repository

options.name: --url
options.description: Install the given package from this URL

options.name: --path
options.description: Install the given package from this local path

options.name: --rev
options.description: Update to a specific git rev

options.name: --branch
options.description: Update to a specific git branch

options.name: --features
options.description: Adds a dependency with a specific feature

options.name: --excluded
options.description: Add this as an excluded dependency that will not be installed even if it's a sub dependency

options.name: --optional
options.description: Add this to an optional dependency group

options.name: --sync
options.description: Runs `sync` even if auto-sync is disabled

options.name: --no-sync
options.description: Does not run `sync` even if auto-sync is enabled

options.name: --pre
options.description: Include pre-releases when finding a package version and automatically syncing the workspace

options.name: --with-sources
options.description: Set to `true` to lock with sources in the lockfile when automatically syncing the workspace

options.name: --generate-hashes
options.description: Set to `true` to lock with hashes in the lockfile when automatically syncing the workspace

options.name: --keyring-provider
options.description: Attempt to use `keyring` for authentication for index URLs

config.name: config
config.description: Reads or modifies the global `config.toml` file

options.name: --show-path
options.description: Print the path to the config

options.name: --format
options.description: Request parseable output format rather than lines

options.name: --set
options.description: Sets a config key to a string

options.name: --set-int
options.description: Sets a config key to an integer

options.name: --set-bool
options.description: Sets a config key to a bool

fetch.name: fetch
fetch.description: Fetches a Python interpreter for the local machine

options.name: --force
options.description: Fetch the Python toolchain even if it is already installed

options.name: --target-path
options.description: Fetches the Python toolchain into an explicit location rather

fmt.name: fmt
fmt.description: Run the code formatter on the project

arguments.name: ...paths
arguments.description: List of files or directories to limit the operation to

options.name: --all
options.description: Perform the operation on all packages

options.name: --package
options.description: Perform the operation on a specific package

init.name: init
init.description: Initialize a new or existing Python project with Rye

options.name: --min-py
options.description: Minimal Python version supported by this project

options.name: --py
options.description: Python version to use for the virtualenv

options.name: --no-pin
options.description: Do not create .python-version file (requires-python will be used)

options.name: --build-system
options.description: Which build system should be used (defaults to hatchling)?

options.name: --license
options.description: Which license should be used (SPDX identifier)?

options.name: --private
options.description: Set "Private :: Do Not Upload" classifier, used for private projects

options.name: --no-import
options.description: Don't import from setup.cfg, setup.py, or requirements files

options.name: --virtual
options.description: Initialize this as a virtual package

options.name: --requirements
options.description: Requirements files to initialize pyproject.toml with

options.name: --dev-requirements
options.description: Development requirements files to initialize pyproject.toml with

install.name: install
install.description: Installs a package as global tool

arguments.name: requirement
arguments.description: The name of the package to install

options.name: --git
options.description: Install the given package from this git repository

options.name: --url
options.description: Install the given package from this URL

options.name: --path
options.description: Install the given package from this local path

options.name: --rev
options.description: Update to a specific git rev

options.name: --branch
options.description: Update to a specific git branch

options.name: --features
options.description: Adds a dependency with a specific feature

options.name: --include-dep
options.description: Include scripts from a given dependency

options.name: --extra-requirement
options.description: Additional dependencies to install that are not declared by the main package

options.name: --python
options.description: Optionally the Python version to use

options.name: --force
options.description: Force install the package even if it's already there

options.name: --keyring-provider
options.description: Attempt to use `keyring` for authentication for index URLs

lock.name: lock
lock.description: Updates the lockfiles without installing dependencies

options.name: --update-all
options.description: Update all packages to the latest

options.name: --features
options.description: Extras/features to enable when locking the workspace

options.name: --with-sources
options.description: Set to true to lock with sources in the lockfile

options.name: --keyring-provider
options.description: Attempt to use `keyring` for authentication for index URLs

options.name: --generate-hashes
options.description: Set to true to lock with hashes in the lockfile

lint.name: lint
lint.description: Run the linter on the project

arguments.name: ...paths
arguments.description: List of files or directories to limit the operation to

options.name: --all
options.description: Perform the operation on all packages

options.name: --package
options.description: Perform the operation on a specific package

make-req.name: make-req
make-req.description: Builds and prints a PEP 508 requirement string from parts

arguments.name: ...requirements
arguments.description: The package to add as PEP 508 requirement string. e.g. 'flask==2.2.3'

options.name: --git
options.description: Install the given package from this git repository

options.name: --url
options.description: Install the given package from this URL

options.name: --path
options.description: Install the given package from this local path

options.name: --rev
options.description: Update to a specific git rev

options.name: --branch
options.description: Update to a specific git branch

options.name: --features
options.description: Adds a dependency with a specific feature

pin.name: pin
pin.description: Pins a Python version to this project

arguments.name: version
arguments.description: The version of Python to pin

options.name: --no-update-requires-python
options.description: Prevent updating requires-python in the pyproject.toml

publish.name: publish
publish.description: Publish packages to a package repository

arguments.name: ...dist
arguments.description: The distribution files to upload to the repository (defaults to <workspace-root>/dist/*)

options.name: --repository-url
options.description: The repository url to publish to

options.name: --username
options.description: The username to authenticate to the repository with

options.name: --token
options.description: An access token used for the upload

options.name: --sign
options.description: Sign files to upload using GPG

options.name: --identity
options.description: GPG identity used to sign files

options.name: --skip-existing
options.description: Skip files that have already been published (only applies to repositories supporting this feature)

remove.name: remove
remove.description: Removes a package from this project

options.name: --optional
options.description: Remove this from an optional dependency group

options.name: --sync
options.description: Runs `sync` even if auto-sync is disabled

options.name: --no-sync
options.description: Does not run `sync` even if auto-sync is enabled

options.name: --pre
options.description: Include pre-releases when automatically syncing the workspace

options.name: --with-sources
options.description: Set to `true` to lock with sources in the lockfile when automatically syncing the workspace

options.name: --generate-hashes
options.description: Set to `true` to lock with hashes in the lockfile when automatically syncing the workspace

options.name: --keyring-provider
options.description: Attempt to use `keyring` for authentication for index URLs

run.name: run
run.description: Runs a command installed into this package

show.name: show
show.description: Prints the current state of the project

options.name: --installed-deps
options.description: Print the installed dependencies from the venv

sync.name: sync
sync.description: Updates the virtualenv based on the pyproject.toml

options.name: --force
options.description: Force the environment to be re-created

options.name: --update-all
options.description: Update all packages to the latest

options.name: --features
options.description: Extras/features to enable when syncing the workspace

options.name: --with-sources
options.description: Set to true to lock with sources in the lockfile

options.name: --keyring-provider
options.description: Attempt to use `keyring` for authentication for index URLs

options.name: --generate-hashes
options.description: Set to true to lock with hashes in the lockfile

options.name: --reset
options.description: Do not reuse (reset) prior lock options

test.name: test
test.description: Run the tests on the project

options.name: --all
options.description: Perform the operation on all packages

options.name: --package
options.description: Perform the operation on a specific package

options.name: --no-capture
options.description: Disable test output capture to stdout

options.name: --pre
options.description: Include pre-releases when automatically syncing the workspace

options.name: --with-sources
options.description: Set to `true` to lock with sources in the lockfile when automatically syncing the workspace

toolchain.name: toolchain
toolchain.description: Helper utility to manage Python toolchains

fetch.name: fetch
fetch.description: Fetches a Python interpreter for the local machine

options.name: --force
options.description: Fetch the Python toolchain even if it is already installed

options.name: --target-path
options.description: Fetches the Python toolchain into an explicit location rather

options.name: --include-downloadable
options.description: Also include non installed, but downloadable toolchains

options.name: --name
options.description: Name of the toolchain.  If not provided a name is auto detected

arguments.name: version
arguments.description: Name and version of the toolchain

options.name: --force
options.description: Force removal even if the toolchain is in use
